response_parsed.title: Securing Web Backends with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive overview of how to secure web backends using FastAPI and Python 3.12+, focusing on best practices for authentication, authorization, and security measures.
key_points: Use FastAPI's built-in dependency injection system for handling authentication and authorization
Implement OAuth2 authentication to secure APIs with third-party identity providers
Leverage JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for user authentication and session management
Implement rate limiting, CORS, and Content Security Policy for additional security measures
Follow security best practices like input validation, parameter sanitization, and error handling

from fastapi.security import OAuth2PasswordBearer
app = FastAPI()
oauth2_scheme = OAuth2PasswordBearer(tokenUrl='token')

@app.post('/login/', response_model=Token)
